title: IntelliJ-based IDE installation
description: Meta-information about installation of an IDE based on IntelliJ Platform

name.description: Full name of the product without edition, e.g. 'IntelliJ IDEA' or 'PyCharm'

version.description: Marketing version of the product, e.g. '2018.3'

versionSuffix.description: Specifies type of this product version which is shown after the version number in the UI, e.g. 'EAP', 'EAP 2', 'Preview', etc. May be omitted (e.g. for release builds).

buildNumber.description: Build number of the product, e.g. '183.239' or '183.SNAPSHOT'

productCode.description: Product code (e.g. 'IC' for IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition) as used in full build number

dataDirectoryName.description: Name of a directory used for storing settings, caches, etc. (e.g. 'IntelliJIdea2020.1' for IntelliJ IDEA 2020.1); the full path to the directory is OS-specific.

svgIconPath.description: Path to an SVG file which contains the product icon (relative to the parent directory of this file, '/' as a separator, may start with '../'), e.g. 'bin/idea.svg'

launch.description: Specifies how the IDE can be launched

os.description: Operation system this launch method is supposed to be used for

launcherPath.description: Path to an executable file which starts the IDE (relative to the parent directory of this file, '/' as a separator, may start with '../'), e.g. 'bin/idea.sh'

javaExecutablePath.description: Path to an JRE executable file (relative to the parent directory of this file, '/' as a separator, may start with '../'), e.g. 'jre64/bin/java'. May be missing if JRE isn't bundled with the product.

vmOptionsFilePath.description: Path to a file containing JVM options which are used to start the IDE (relative to the parent directory of this file, '/' as a separator, may start with '../'), e.g. 'bin/idea64.vmoptions'

startupWmClass.description: Value of 'WMClass' property used by some Linux desktop distributions to associate windows with the owning application, e.g. 'jetbrains-idea'. May be specified only if 'os' is 'Linux'.
